snippet: The English head-quaners were, for the east division, Alnwick or Ber-vvick ; the castle of Harbottle was the central ; and, when wardens of the western marches.

title: Traditions of Edinburgh.
author: Chambers, Robert
snippet: (As the real case is reported in. Pitcairn's Criminal Trials,it appears that, in September 1601, Gibson was carried off from the neighbourhood of St Andrews by George Meldrum, younger of Dumbreck,and hastily transported  to the castle of Harbottle in Northumberland, and kept there for eight days.) But, after all, Scotland was not singular among European nations in these respects.
